Detailed Description

This class is an extension to stPage which can block access to part of the physical page. This segment is always located in the begining of the page.

The stLockablePage was designed to hide a portion of the page from the SlimTree. The locked segment may be used to store PageManager's reserved information such a page header.

Author:
Fabio Jun Takada Chino (chino@icmc.usp.br)

Marcos Rodrigues Vieira (mrvieira@icmc.usp.br)

Version:
1.0
Todo:
Tests.

Member Function Documentation

virtual stByte* stLockablePage::GetData (   )  [virtual]
 

Returns the pointer to the data array. This method allows the direct access to the internal page data array. The returned pointer do not include the locked segment. See GetTrueData() to get a pointer to the entire page.

Avoid to use this method. If a read/write operation is required, use Read() and Write() methods instead.

Returns:
The pointer to the data array of this page.
See also:
GetTrueData()

Reimplemented from stPage.

Returns the size of the locked segment.

virtual stSize stLockablePage::GetPageSize (   )  [virtual]
 

Returns the page size in bytes. This value does not include the size of the locked segment.

Returns:
The page size in bytes.

const stByte* stLockablePage::GetTrueData (   )  [inline]
 

This method returns the true data array of this page. This array will include the locked segment.

See also:

stSize stLockablePage::GetTruePageSize (   )  [inline]
 

Returns the true page size. This size is the size of the page plus the size of the locked segment.

virtual void stLockablePage::Write (  stByte *  buff,
stSize  n,
stSize  offset
)  [virtual]
 

Writes n bytes to this page and sets the cursor to the next writing position. This method can not be used to write to the locked segment.

Parameters:
buff The byte array to be written.
offset Position where the buff will be written.
n Number of bytes to write.
Warning:
This method will not perform error checking unless __stDEBUG__ is defined at compile time.
